headline: Six Axes of Morality
description: A structured sequence of twelve moral thought experiments arranged along six axes. Each axis interrogates a different dimension of moral being: interpretation, secrecy, endurance, leadership, temptation, and justice. The piece functions as both a psychological test and a meditative mirror, designed to provoke honest reflection and self-confrontation.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
whyItMatters: The 'Six Axes of Morality' reimagines moral reflection not as judgment but as inner cartography. The structure transforms philosophy into praxis: a mirror of conscience through participation.
